comments:
In the new feature editor, I tried putting text into the "URL:" field.

At first, I put: C:\Eclipse\eclipse-N20040426\eclipse
which gave the MalformedURLException below.
A value that does work is file:\C:\Eclipse\eclipse-N20040426\eclipse.

This isn't really a 'bad' thing since we're looking for a specific format of the
URL, however, I don't think that we should be throwing exceptions from the
editor if we can help it :(

Possible Solutions?
1.  Have a message box warn the user that the URL is invalid, setText to ""
(blank string), and leave focus on the URL field so the user can try again.

2.  Have solution 1 in conjunction with a "Browse..." or "..." such that you can
select a location and format the selected URL as required

Regrettably, I don't know if these solutions would suffice but they might be a
starting block. :)

The exception thrown:

You should not be allowed to enter malformed exception in the first place. 

As you enter new text, an attempt to create a new URL object should be made 
in 'modifyText' to check for the very exception you mentioned.

Fixed by showing an error dialog (but not CoreException error) for malformed 
URLs. Also reverting to the old value.
